thread.title: Royals take two-game lead in ALCS after 6-3 win over Blue Jays
thread.title_full: Royals take two-game lead in ALCS after 6-3 win over Blue Jays

author: Tribune wire reports
title: Royals take two-game lead in ALCS after 6-3 win over Blue Jays
text:
var ssaUrl = ('https:' == document.location.protocol ? 'https://' : 'http://') + 'pixel.sitescout.com/iap/0ea84626951144d2';new Image().src = ssaUrl;"/> Baseball Royals take two-game lead in ALCS after 6-3 win over Blue Jays Mike Moustakas Jae C. Hong / AP 
Kansas City Royals' Mike Moustakas hits an RBI single against the Toronto Blue Jays during the eighth inning in Game 2 of the American League Championship Series. 
Kansas City Royals' Mike Moustakas hits an RBI single against the Toronto Blue Jays during the eighth inning in Game 2 of the American League Championship Series. (Jae C. Hong / AP) Tribune wire reports Contact Reporter 
Ben Zobrist's easy fly that somehow fell in for a hit began a five-run rally against David Price, and the Kansas City Royals rolled to a 6-3 victory over the Toronto Blue Jays on Saturday for a 2-0 lead in the AL Championship Series. 
Wade Davis survived a shaky ninth for Kansas City after Luke Hochevar and Danny Duffy were solid in relief of Yordano Ventura. Kelvin Herrera breezed through the eighth. 
Davis gave up a leadoff single and walked pinch-hitter Cliff Pennington, but bounced back to strike out leadoff man Ben Revere and MVP candidate Josh Donaldson. Jose Bautista then flied out to right to give Davis his third postseason save and the Royals another postseason comeback win. 
Associated Press
